title: 513-Mile 1996 Chevrolet Corvette Grand Sport Convertible 6-Speed
description: This 1996 Chevrolet Corvette is one of 190 Grand Sport convertibles built for the model year to commemorate the end of C4 production. The car has 513 miles following time spent with several owners. It is powered by a 5.7-liter LT4 V8 linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential, and it is finished in Admiral Blue with a white racing stripe over black leather. Equipment includes the Selective Ride and Handling Package, 17" black five-spoke alloy wheels, a white vinyl convertible soft top, fog lights, power-adjustable sport seats, a Delco Bose CD stereo, and automatic climate control. This C4 Grand Sport is now offered in Maryland by the selling dealer with the owner's manual, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Florida title.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a 513-Mile 1996 Chevrolet Corvette Grand Sport Convertible 6-Speed at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #179,780.
text: This 1996 Chevrolet Corvette is one of 190 Grand Sport convertibles built for the model year to commemorate the end of C4 production. The car has 513 miles following time spent with several owners. It is powered by a 5.7-liter LT4 V8 linked with a six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential, and it is finished in Admiral Blue with a white racing stripe over black leather. Equipment includes the Selective Ride and Handling Package, 17″ black five-spoke alloy wheels, a white vinyl convertible soft top, fog lights, power-adjustable sport seats, a Delco Bose CD stereo, and automatic climate control. This C4 Grand Sport is now offered in Maryland by the selling dealer with the owner’s manual, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Florida title. All C4 Corvette Grand Sport examples were finished in Admiral Blue (28) and featured a white central stripe with twin red hash marks above the left front wheel. Exterior equipment includes pop-up headlights, fog lights, a white vinyl convertible soft top, a Corvette-branded front plate cover, and quad tail lights. The 17″ black five-spoke alloy wheels are mounted with Goodyear Eagle GS-C tires. The car is equipped with traction control and the Selective Ride and Handling Package, which added adjustable dampers. Stopping power is provided by four-wheel ventilated discs with ABS. A brake fluid flush was performed in January 2025. The cabin features power-adjustable sport seats trimmed in black leather with red Grand Sport headrest embroidery. Amenities include a Delco Bose CD stereo, cruise control, automatic climate control, an onboard computer, and power windows and locks. The two-spoke leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a central digital speedometer, a fuel level monitor, and analog instrumentation consisting of a tachometer and gauges for oil pressure, oil temperature, coolant temperature, and voltage. The digital odometer indicates 513 miles. The 5.7-liter LT4 V8 was factory-rated at 330 horsepower and 340 lb-ft of torque. An oil change was performed in preparation for the sale. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a ZF six-speed manual transmission and a limited-slip differential. The Carfax report is free of accidents or other damage.
